title: Chipstars
author: Chipstars

comments.author: Slow death
comments.body: It seems to me that your thread belongs to the Games and rounds section and does not belong in this section, that's because it is not an ann thread, it is not a discussion thread, but rather it is a thread with the aim of doing some promotion, therefore it belongs to Games and rounds section. I could see in your casino that the person who participates in this promotion must be aware that they will have to go through kyc, I have nothing against a casino asking for kyc but as long as they only ask for it when they detect any suspicious activity. and in your casino they will ask for kyc as one of the requirements for this promotionI was wondering how many people will take the risk of participating in this promotion knowing that they can earn little or not win anything and even so they have to go through kyc as a condition for this promotion, in my opinion few people will take this risk, so I see this promotion as only aimed at people who already use your casino frequently and have already gone through kyc, now for new customers I highly doubt that many new customers will appear thanks to this promotionA few days ago I saw a new casino making the same mistake, I don't know to what extent the marketing department of certain casinos have researched before creating and launching a promotion, but I must say that I am shocked by what I have seen. People like everything simple and practical and that have a chance of making a profit, and that's what attracts people. now when you have things like kyc immediately, an unclear bonus that isn't very advantageous, these types of promotions hardly attract much attention from people, this is my opinion, I could be wrong
